qas.question: What superpower in 1980 created a stamp in honor of Avicenna?
A medical staff training college named in his honor is how many miles away from his birthplace?
In 1980, how many years had it been since Avicenna's birth?
Besides stamps, what did the Soviet Union also create in Avicenna's honor?
What superpower in 1908 created a stamp in honor of Avicenna?
A medical staff training college named in his honor is how many kilometers away from his birthplace?
In 1980, how many years had it been since Avicenna's death?
Besides stamps, what did the Soviet Union also destroy in Avicenna's honor?

context: In 1980, <a0_0><b5_0>the Soviet Union<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which then ruled his birthplace <a1_0><b6_0>Bukhara<b6_0/><a1_0/>, celebrated the <a3_0><b8_0>thousand<b8_0/><a3_0/>th anniversary of Avicenna's birth by circulating various commemorative stamps with artistic illustrations, and by erecting <a4_0><b9_0>a bust<b9_0/><a4_0/> of Avicenna based on anthropological research by Soviet scholars.[citation needed] Near his birthplace in Qishlak Afshona, some 25 km (<a2_0><b7_0>16<a2_0/> mi<b7_0/>) north of Bukhara, a training college for medical staff has been named for him.[year needed] On the grounds is a museum dedicated to his life, times and work.[citation needed]
